page.title: 10A Sparkwell Family Holiday
page.content: Last summer we went to stay in a country cottage at Hurstbourne Priors in Hampshire. Opposite the cottage is an orchard which belongs to the cottage. Near the cottage there is a river and opposite the cottage is a church. It is called St.Andrew's Church. We went down to the river on our first day. We saw the place where they used to hang people for stealing in the olden days. Stonehenge is about 10 miles away. We went to Southsea to catch the hovercraft over to the Isle of Wight. We saw the Bourne Valley which is famous for its water-cress beds. We enjoyed our holiday in Hampshire very much. Andrew Wilton
